required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 6-Month Study Of CP-690,550 Versus Tacrolimus In Kidney Transplant Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A 6-Month, Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Open-Label, Comparative Study Of 2 Dose Levels Of CP-690,550 Administered Concomitantly With IL-2 Receptor Antagonist Induction Therapy, Mycophenolate Mofetil And Corticosteroids Versus A Tacrolimus-Based Immunosuppressive Regimen For The Prevention Of Allograft Rejection In De Novo Renal Allograft Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 2 study was designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of 2 dose levels of CP-690,550 (15 mg twice daily and 30 mg twice) against tacrolimus, in combination with basiliximab induction, mycophenolate mofetil and corticosteroids, in kidney transplant patients. Stage 1 was to randomize approximately 54 subjects. After all Stage 1 subjects had completed 6 months of treatment, Stage 2 was to randomize an additional 195 subjects to the same treatment groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Biopsy Proven Acute Rejection (BPAR) at Month 6
primary_outcome.description: BPAR categorized as acute rejection as interpreted by the central blinded pathologist according to the Banff 97 working classification.

primary_outcome.measure: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Nankivell Equation at Month 6
primary_outcome.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated by creatinine clearance (CLcr) using Nankivell equation. CLcr by Nankivell equation= (6.7 per serum creatinine) plus (0.25*body weight) minus (0.5*serum urea) minus (100 per square height) plus (35 for male/25 for female). A normal GFR is >90 milliliter/minute (mL/min), although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure was defined as the first occurrence of BPAR, graft loss, participant's death or premature discontinuation of study medication for any reason.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Biopsy Proven Acute Rejection (BPAR) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: BPAR categorized as acute rejection as interpreted by the central blinded pathologist according to the Banff 97 working classification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Biopsy Proven Chronic Allograft Nephropathy (BPCAN)
secondary_outcome.description: BPCAN categorized as chronic allograft nephropathy as interpreted by the central blinded pathologist according to the Banff 97 working classification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Ordered Categorical Severity of First Biopsy Proven Acute Rejection (BPAR)
secondary_outcome.description: Ordered categorical severity of first BPAR was classified according to the Banff Classification. Grade IA: moderate tubulitis, grade IB: severe tubulitis, grade IIA: mild to moderate intimal arteritis, grade IIB: severe intimal arteritis, grade III: transmural arteritis. (Racusen et al: The Banff classification, 1999).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Ordered Categorical Severity of First Biopsy Proven Chronic Allograft Nephropathy (BPCAN)
secondary_outcome.description: Ordered categorical severity of first BPCAN was classified according to the Banff Classification. Grade I: mild, grade II: moderate and grade III: severe interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy/loss. (Racusen et al: The Banff classification, 1999).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Efficacy Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy failure was the first occurrence of BPAR, graft loss or participant's death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Graft Loss
secondary_outcome.description: Graft loss was defined as graft nephrectomy, participant's death due to graft loss, re-transplantation, or return to dialysis for greater than or equal to (>=) 6 consecutive weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died
Number of Participants With Rejection
secondary_outcome.description: Rejection was defined as first occurrence of BPAR, antibody mediated rejection, or suspicious for acute rejection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Population Pharmacokinetics (PK)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1, 3, 7, 14, Month 1, 3, 6, between 1 to 2 hours post-dose at Month 3 and between 3 to 4 hours post-dose at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Data for this Outcome Measure are not reported here because the analysis population includes participants who were not enrolled in this study. ClinicalTrials.gov is designed for reporting results from only those participants who were enrolled in the study and described in the Participant Flow and Baseline Characteristics modules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fluorescence-Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) of Lymphocyte Subsets
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute cell counts of cluster of differentiation 8 (CD8): Cytotoxic T-lymphocytes reactive with major histocompatibility complex-1 (MHC-I), CD19: B- Lymphocytes, CD56: natural killer cells were determined using FACS, a specialized type of flow cytometry which sorts a heterogeneous mixture based upon the specific light scattering and fluorescent characteristics of each cell.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reticulocyte Count
secondary_outcome.description: Reticulocytes are slightly immature red blood cells in the blood. Reticulocyte counts are reported as cells*10^3 per cubic millimeter (cells*10^3/mm^3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Levels of Tacrolimus (TAC)
36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) Version 2.0 (V2)
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. These 8 aspects can also be summarized as physical and mental component scores (CS). Total of 11 variables were analyzed (8 subscales, 2 composite subscales and Question 2 "how would you rate your health in general now?" (range 1= better, 5= worst). The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

secondary_outcome.measure: End-Stage Renal Disease Symptom Checklist-Transplantation Module (ESRD-SCL)
secondary_outcome.description: ESRD-SCL:43-item disease specific self-administered questionnaire. Participants' rated question"At the moment,how much do you suffer?"for each item on 5 point scale,ranged (Ra) 0(not at all)to 4(extremely).Consisted of 6 subscales:cardiac and renal dysfunction;Ra 0-28,increased(In) growth of gum and hair;Ra 0-20,limited cognitive capacity;Ra 0-32,limited physical capacity;Ra 0-40,side effects (SEs) of corticosteroids;Ra 0-20,transplantation associated psychological distress(TAPD);Ra 0-32(higher scores=greater dysfunction for each subscale).Total score:0-172,higher scores=greater dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ) was used to assess healthcare resources which included number of events such as physician and other health professional visits, number of treatments or diagnostic tests, number of hospitalizations, and number of emergency room visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ) - 5th Question
secondary_outcome.description: Fifth question in the HCRUQ was "Upon discharge from the hospital, did you return to your previous place of residence?" and number of participants who responded "yes or no" to the question was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Cockcroft-Gault
secondary_outcome.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated using Cockcroft-Gault equation. GFR by Cockcroft-Gault equation= body weight*(140 minus age in years) divided by (72*serum creatinine). For females, value obtained was multiplied by 0.85. A normal GFR is >90 mL/min, although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Equation
secondary_outcome.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated using MDRD equation. GFR by MDRD equation= 170 * (serum creatinine) ^ (-0.999)*(age in years)^(-0.176)*(0.762 if female) * (1.18 if black)*(blood urea nitrogen concentration)^(-0.170)*(serum albumin concentration)^(0.318). Normal GFR is >90 mL/min/1.73 square meter (m^2), although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Reciprocal of Serum Creatinine (1/sCr)
secondary_outcome.description: GFR is a measure of renal function. The reciprocal of serum creatinine is an estimate of GFR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 8 (2 months follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 2 months after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Clinically Significant Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant (Viral, Bacterial and Fungal) infection was defined as the presence of presumed or documented infection confirmed by culture, biopsy, genomic or serologic findings post-randomization and required hospitalization or anti-infective treatment, or otherwise deemed significant by the Investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With New Onset Diabetes Mellitus (NODM)
Fasting Serum Glucose Levels
Number of Participants With Hypercholesterolemia
secondary_outcome.description: Hypercholesterolemia is a condition characterized by very high levels of cholesterol in the blood. Hypercholesterolemia was defined as a value of total serum cholesterol greater than 240 mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Serum Cholesterol, Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL) and High Density Lipoprotein (HDL) Levels
Number of Participants With Hypertriglyceridemia
secondary_outcome.description: Hypertriglyceridemia was defined as a value of triglycerides greater than 200 mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Supine Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure (BP)
Number of Participants With Drug Usage
secondary_outcome.description: Lipid lowering agents, antihypertensive agents, oral hypoglycemic agents (OHA) , anti-diabetic agents (ADA) and insulin drug usage was collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Epstein Barr Virus (EBV) and Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) Load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6 for CMV; Baseline, Day 14, Month 1, 3, 6 for EBV

secondary_outcome.measure: BK Virus (BKV) Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) Load
Number of Participants With Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Disease
Total White Blood Cells (WBC), Absolute Basophil, Absolute Eosinophil, Absolute Lymphocyte, Absolute Monocyte, Absolute Neutrophil
Absolute Platelet Levels
Hemoglobin Level
secondary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin is the protein molecule in red blood cells that carries oxygen from the lungs to the body's tissues and returns carbon dioxide from the tissues back to the lungs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hematocrit Level
secondary_outcome.description: The hematocrit is recorded as the percentage of volume of red blood cells (RBCs) in a blood sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Level
secondary_outcome.description: ALT is the enzyme found in the liver and it is measured to see if the liver is damaged or diseased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Electrocardiogram (ECG) Parameters
secondary_outcome.description: ECG parameters included PR interval, QT interval, corrected QT using Bazett's formula (QTcB) and QTc using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) interval, and QRS width.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Discontinuation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recipient of a first-time kidney transplant
- Between the ages of 18 and 70 years, inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recipient of any non-kidney transplant

outcome.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Nankivell Equation at Month 6
outcome.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated by creatinine clearance (CLcr) using Nankivell equation. CLcr by Nankivell equation= (6.7 per serum creatinine) plus (0.25*body weight) minus (0.5*serum urea) minus (100 per square height) plus (35 for male/25 for female). A normal GFR is >90 milliliter/minute (mL/min), although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) Version 2.0 (V2)
outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. These 8 aspects can also be summarized as physical and mental component scores (CS). Total of 11 variables were analyzed (8 subscales, 2 composite subscales and Question 2 “how would you rate your health in general now?” (range 1= better, 5= worst). The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

measure.title: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) Version 2.0 (V2)
measure.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. These 8 aspects can also be summarized as physical and mental component scores (CS). Total of 11 variables were analyzed (8 subscales, 2 composite subscales and Question 2 “how would you rate your health in general now?” (range 1= better, 5= worst). The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
measure.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

outcome.title: End-Stage Renal Disease Symptom Checklist-Transplantation Module (ESRD-SCL)
outcome.description: ESRD-SCL:43-item disease specific self-administered questionnaire. Participants’ rated question“At the moment,how much do you suffer?”for each item on 5 point scale,ranged (Ra) 0(not at all)to 4(extremely).Consisted of 6 subscales:cardiac and renal dysfunction;Ra 0-28,increased(In) growth of gum and hair;Ra 0-20,limited cognitive capacity;Ra 0-32,limited physical capacity;Ra 0-40,side effects (SEs) of corticosteroids;Ra 0-20,transplantation associated psychological distress(TAPD);Ra 0-32(higher scores=greater dysfunction for each subscale).Total score:0-172,higher scores=greater dysfunction.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

group.description: CP-690,550 15 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: CP-690,550 30 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 30 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg or 1 mg capsule administered orally as per local clinical practice up to Month 6.

measure.description: ESRD-SCL:43-item disease specific self-administered questionnaire. Participants’ rated question“At the moment,how much do you suffer?”for each item on 5 point scale,ranged (Ra) 0(not at all)to 4(extremely).Consisted of 6 subscales:cardiac and renal dysfunction;Ra 0-28,increased(In) growth of gum and hair;Ra 0-20,limited cognitive capacity;Ra 0-32,limited physical capacity;Ra 0-40,side effects (SEs) of corticosteroids;Ra 0-20,transplantation associated psychological distress(TAPD);Ra 0-32(higher scores=greater dysfunction for each subscale).Total score:0-172,higher scores=greater dysfunction.
measure.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. outcome.title: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ)
outcome.description: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ) was used to assess healthcare resources which included number of events such as physician and other health professional visits, number of treatments or diagnostic tests, number of hospitalizations, and number of emergency room visits.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. measure.title: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ)
measure.description: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ) was used to assess healthcare resources which included number of events such as physician and other health professional visits, number of treatments or diagnostic tests, number of hospitalizations, and number of emergency room visits.

outcome.title: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ) - 5th Question
outcome.description: Fifth question in the HCRUQ was “Upon discharge from the hospital, did you return to your previous place of residence?” and number of participants who responded "yes or no" to the question was reported.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure.

measure.title: Healthcare Resource Utilization Questionnaire (HCRUQ) - 5th Question
measure.description: Fifth question in the HCRUQ was “Upon discharge from the hospital, did you return to your previous place of residence?” and number of participants who responded "yes or no" to the question was reported.
measure.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Cockcroft-Gault
outcome.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated using Cockcroft-Gault equation. GFR by Cockcroft-Gault equation= body weight*(140 minus age in years) divided by (72*serum creatinine). For females, value obtained was multiplied by 0.85. A normal GFR is >90 mL/min, although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

group.title: CP-690,550 15 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 15 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: CP-690,550 30 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 30 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg or 1 mg capsule administered orally as per local clinical practice up to Month 6.

measure.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Cockcroft-Gault
measure.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated using Cockcroft-Gault equation. GFR by Cockcroft-Gault equation= body weight*(140 minus age in years) divided by (72*serum creatinine). For females, value obtained was multiplied by 0.85. A normal GFR is >90 mL/min, although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.
measure.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

outcome.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Equation
outcome.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated using MDRD equation. GFR by MDRD equation= 170 * (serum creatinine) ^ (-0.999)*(age in years)^(-0.176)*(0.762 if female) * (1.18 if black)*(blood urea nitrogen concentration)^(-0.170)*(serum albumin concentration)^(0.318). Normal GFR is >90 mL/min/1.73 square meter (m^2), although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each group respectively.

group.title: CP-690,550 15 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 15 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: CP-690,550 30 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 30 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg or 1 mg capsule administered orally as per local clinical practice up to Month 6.

measure.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Equation
measure.description: GFR: index of kidney function described the flow rate of filtered fluid through the kidney. GFR was measured directly or estimated using established formulas. GFR was calculated using MDRD equation. GFR by MDRD equation= 170 * (serum creatinine) ^ (-0.999)*(age in years)^(-0.176)*(0.762 if female) * (1.18 if black)*(blood urea nitrogen concentration)^(-0.170)*(serum albumin concentration)^(0.318). Normal GFR is >90 mL/min/1.73 square meter (m^2), although children and older people usually have a lower GFR. Lower values indicated poor kidney function. A GFR <15 mL/min indicated kidney failure.
measure.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Reciprocal of Serum Creatinine (1/sCr)
outcome.description: GFR is a measure of renal function. The reciprocal of serum creatinine is an estimate of GFR.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points.

measure.title: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) by Reciprocal of Serum Creatinine (1/sCr)
measure.description: GFR is a measure of renal function. The reciprocal of serum creatinine is an estimate of GFR.
measure.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 2 months after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 8 (2 months follow-up)
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: CP-690,550 15 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 15 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg or 1 mg capsule administered orally as per local clinical practice up to Month 6.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 2 months after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.
measure.population: Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With First Clinically Significant Infection
outcome.description: Clinically significant (Viral, Bacterial and Fungal) infection was defined as the presence of presumed or documented infection confirmed by culture, biopsy, genomic or serologic findings post-randomization and required hospitalization or anti-infective treatment, or otherwise deemed significant by the Investigator.
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.description: CP-690,550 15 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: CP-690,550 30 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 30 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg or 1 mg capsule administered orally as per local clinical practice up to Month 6.

measure.title: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Level
measure.description: ALT is the enzyme found in the liver and it is measured to see if the liver is damaged or diseased.
measure.population: Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

outcome.title: Electrocardiogram (ECG) Parameters
outcome.description: ECG parameters included PR interval, QT interval, corrected QT using Bazett's formula (QTcB) and QTc using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) interval, and QRS width.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, N (Number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and ‘n’ signifies those participants evaluable at specific time points for each arm group respectively.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: CP-690,550 15 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 15 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: CP-690,550 30 mg
group.description: CP-690,550 30 mg tablet orally twice daily up to Month 6.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg or 1 mg capsule administered orally as per local clinical practice up to Month 6.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Results for first BPAR, BPCAN, treatment and efficacy failure, rejection, clinically significant infections, NODM and discontinuation reported as number and not percentage as planned. Stage 2 of study was not conducted due to administrative reasons.
